From the Editor In 2021, Marianne Lake and Jennifer Piepszak were named joint leads of JPMorgan's consumer operations, which accounts for nearly 40% of the company's profits. Lake first joined JPMorgan in 1999. She served as the Chief Financial Officer from 2013-2019 and the CEO of Consumer Lending from 2019 to 2021. Piepszak started at bank in 1994. She was its CFO from 2019 to 2021 and before that served as the CEO of Card Services, CEO of Business Banking and CFO for Mortgage Banking. Both Lake and Piepszak are seen as potential successors to CEO Jamie Dimon; Wall Street analysts have called them equally powerful and equally capable of doing the job. In 2024, Lake became the sole CEO of Chase Consumer & Community Banking and Piepzsak became the Co-CEO of J.P. Morgan?s Commercial and Investment Bank. Choose Role: All Choose Office: All All Chicago Dallas London Miami New York San Francisco Filter Roles All Partners Investment Team Investor Relations & Marketing Capital Markets Compliance & Legal Responsible Growth & Governance (RGo) Finance Human Resources Information Technology & Security Support Operating Team Location All San Francisco Chicago SEARCH RESULTS Seth Boro Managing Partner Seth Boro Managing Partner Seth Boro is a Managing Partner at Thoma Bravo. Since joining in 2005, he has been instrumental in managing the firm and supporting its growth and success across the software and technology space. Based in San Francisco, Seth leads Thoma Bravo’s infrastructure software and cybersecurity strategy. He also serves on the investment committees for all Thoma Bravo funds, and currently sits on the boards of Calabrio , ConnectWise , Darktrace , Flexera , Hyland , LogRhythm , Ping Identity , Proofpoint , Qlik , SailPoint and Sophos . During his time at Thoma Bravo, Seth has held more than 30 board seats, led over 15 exits, and helped Thoma Bravo establish one of the largest cybersecurity portfolios in private equity, representing approximately $60 billion in total enterprise value. [1] Seth has also received industry recognition for the deals he has led, including the 2023 sale of Imperva to Thales (Private Equity Deal of the Year at the 2024 International M&A Awards [2] ) and the 2019 sale of DigiCert (Private Equity Deal of the Year by The Deal [3] ). In addition to his contributions to the private equity sector, Seth, alongside his wife, Jen Hamilton, founded the Room to Breathe Project, which is committed to supporting and improving young people’s mental health and well-being, with a specific focus on under-resourced communities. Seth is also a Board Observer at Bay FC and the Northern Super League and serves on the boards of the NHL’s Ottawa Senators, the Ottawa Rapid FC and the Canada Soccer Foundation. Originally from Canada, Seth received his Bachelor of Commerce degree from Queen’s University School of Business, and later earned his MBA from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business. Seth began his career as an analyst at First Marathon Securities (now National Bank Financial) before joining the investment bank Credit Suisse in Toronto. Prior to Thoma Bravo, Seth was part of the investment team at Summit Partners, where he focused on private equity investments in the technology and business services sectors. Given Seth’s deep expertise in the fields of technology and cybersecurity, he regularly provides insights on sector trends, opportunities and risks through media interviews and at global industry events, including the Milken Institute Global Conference. 1 Includes control and non-control investments as of December 31, 2024. 2 This award is the opinion of the party conferring the award and not of Thoma Bravo. The International M&A Awards, issued by M&A Advisor on 7/25/24, were based on the time period of 1/1/23 to 3/31/24. Thoma Bravo paid a processing fee in relation to the award. In general, the receipt of compensation influences, and is likely to present a potential material conflict of interest, relating to any granted award. There can be no assurance that other providers or surveys would utilize the same criteria used to determine this award or reach the same conclusion. 3 This award is the opinion of the party conferring the award and not of Thoma Bravo. The Deal Awards, issued by the Deal on 9/25/2020, were based on the time period of 1/1/2019 to 12/31/2019. There can be no assurance that other providers or surveys would utilize the same criteria used to determine this award or reach the same conclusion. 415-249-6719 EDUCATION MBA, Stanford Graduate School of Business Bachelor of Commerce, Queen’s University School of Business PRIOR EXPERIENCE Summit Partners, Palo Alto, CA ServiceSource, San Francisco, CA Credit Suisse, Toronto, Ontario, Canada First Marathon Securities (National Bank Financial), Toronto, Ontario, Canada Orlando Bravo Founder and Managing Partner Orlando Bravo Founder and Managing Partner Scott Crabill Managing Partner Scott Crabill Managing Partner Scott Crabill is a Managing Partner at Thoma Bravo. Since joining in 2002, he has played a critical role in the firm’s growth and evolution into one of the world’s largest software investors. Scott is responsible for co-leading Thoma Bravo’s application software investing efforts. He also serves on the investment committees for all Thoma Bravo funds, and currently sits on the boards of ABC Fitness Solutions, Imprivata, J.D. Power, Medallia, QAD, Quorum and RealPage. In his 20+ years at Thoma Bravo, Scott has served on the boards of 25 portfolio companies and has led 15 exits. In addition to his work in private equity, Scott is engaged in several local philanthropic initiatives. In 2018, he and his wife, Angela, co founded the Crabill Family Foundation, which seeks to ensure more equitable access to healthcare, education, housing and enriching arts opportunities in their hometowns of San Francisco, CA, and Springfield, Ohio. Scott also serves on the board of the California Pacific Medical Center Foundation, the capital-raising arm of Sutter Health hospital in San Francisco. Scott received his BS in Industrial Engineering from Stanford University and his MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business. He began his career in corporate finance at Alex. Brown & Sons., followed by an investment role at the private equity firm J.H. Whitney. Directly prior to Thoma Bravo, Scott was part of the investment team at Summit Partners, where he was involved in private equity investments in software and other technology businesses. A recognized leader in software private equity, Scott has been featured in prominent news outlets and podcasts, including Capital Allocators, and regularly hosts software CEOs and founders on Thoma Bravo’s award-winning Behind the Deal podcast. 415-263-3662 EDUCATION MBA, Stanford Graduate School of Business BS, Industrial Engineering, Stanford University PRIOR EXPERIENCE Summit Partners, Palo Alto, CA Hewlett-Packard Company, Palo Alto, CA J.H. Whitney & Co., New Canaan, CT Alex. Brown & Sons, San Francisco, CA Lee M. Mitchell Managing Partner Lee M. Mitchell Managing Partner Lee Mitchell is a Managing Partner at Thoma Bravo. Based in Chicago, he participated in forming the firm in 1998 and has played a pivotal role in guiding its investment strategy over the last 25+ years. Lee previously was a Partner in Thoma Bravo’s predecessor firm, Golder, Thoma, Cressey, Rauner (GTCR). Before that, he was President and CEO of The Field Corporation and its predecessor, Field Enterprises, Inc., which owned and operated businesses in newspaper and educational publishing (including the Chicago Sun-Times and My Weekly Reader), direct marketing, television (including stations in Chicago and San Francisco), cable television and commercial real estate. He also has been a practicing attorney specializing in regulated industries as a Partner with Sidley Austin in Washington, D.C., and Chicago, and later oversaw that firm’s Asian offices. Outside of Thoma Bravo, Lee is committed to sharing his deep expertise by participating on the boards of several civic and cultural institutions. He is a Life-Trustee of Northwestern University, where he has been Chair of the Investments Committee, and of affiliates of Northwestern Memorial Hospital, where he has been a member of the Investment Committee and Chair of the Alternative Investments Subcommittee. He also is a member of the Board of the American Investment Council in Washington, D.C., and of the Illinois Venture Capital Association, where he has been the Chair and PAC Chair. He is the former Chairman of The Chicago Stock Exchange, which makes an alternative market in NYSE, AMEX and NASDAQ stocks, and two-time Past Chair of the Metropolitan Planning Council, a civic organization focused on maintaining an equitable and economically competitive Chicago region. Lee received his BA from Wesleyan University and JD from the University of Chicago Law School. 312-254-3350 EDUCATION JD, University of Chicago Law School BA, Wesleyan University PRIOR EXPERIENCE Partner, Golder, Thoma, Cressey, Rauner, Inc., Chicago, IL President & CEO, The Field Corporation, Chicago, IL President & CEO, Field Enterprises, Inc., Chicago, IL Partner, Sidley Austin, LLP, Washington, DC and Chicago, IL OTHER ACTIVITIES Former Chair, The Chicago Stock Exchange, Inc. Former Chair, Metropolitan Planning Council, Chicago, IL Trustee (and Former Chair, Investment Committee), Northwestern University Trustee (and Former Vice Chair, Investment Committee), Northwestern Memorial Hospital Corp. Board Member, American Investment Capital (AIC), Washington, DC Board Member (and Former Chair), Illinois Venture Capital Association Commercial Club of Chicago Economic Club of Chicago Holden Spaht Managing Partner Holden Spaht Managing Partner Holden Spaht is a Managing Partner at Thoma Bravo. Based in San Francisco, he joined the firm in 2005 and has played a key role in the firm's growth and success in software private equity. Holden is responsible for leading the firm’s application software strategy, with a specific focus on the financial technology, e-commerce, education, and office of the CFO spaces, among other sectors. He also serves on the investment committees for all Thoma Bravo funds, and currently sits on the boards of Anaplan , Auctane , Bottomline Technologies , Conga , Coupa Software , and Nasdaq . Over his career at Thoma Bravo, Holden has held nearly two dozen board seats, led over 15 exits, and been at the forefront of digital transformation in enterprise software. He has been recognized many times over for the deals he has led, including the 2023 sale of Adenza to Nasdaq (Tech Deal of the Year at the 2024 Americas M&A Atlas awards [1] ; M&A Deal of the Year at the 2024 International M&A Awards [2] ; and Information Technology Deal of the Year [over $1B] at the 2024 M&A Advisor Awards [3] ), the 2023 acquisition of Coupa (Deal of the Year in North America by PEI Awards 2023 [4] ), as well as the 2020 sale of Ellie Mae to Intercontinental Exchange (Buyouts' Deal of the Year [5] ). Beyond his work in private equity, Holden is deeply committed to philanthropic causes. He is the President and Chair of the Spaht Family Foundation, which Holden founded with his wife, Claire, in 2019. The foundation, which focuses on mental health, the arts, environmental conservation, and humanitarian assistance, is also the lead donor to the Lindley Center , Washington & Lee University’s student health and wellness clinic that bears the name of his late sister. In addition, Holden and his foundation have been active in community development, education, and athletic initiatives. His foundation has also been a strategic investor in programming targeted at the intersection of athletics and mental health, including support for his alma mater’s Peak Performance Training program (driven in part by his own days as the captain of Dartmouth’s tennis team). Among other activities, Holden has also served as the Chair of the Board of Trustees for Schools of the Sacred Heart San Francisco, where he helped guide the institution's strategic direction and growth. The son of educators, Holden was born and raised in Baton Rouge, Louisiana (and he remains a rabid LSU football fan to this day). He attended Dartmouth College, earning a BA in Economics, and went on to study International Politics at the University of Cologne on a Fulbright Scholarship. He later earned an MBA from Harvard Business School. Holden began his career as an Analyst at Morgan Stanley in New York and subsequently held Analyst and Associate roles at Thomas H. Lee Partners in Boston and Morgan Stanley in London and San Francisco. A thought leader on the intersection of finance and technology, Holden provides data-driven analyses and commentary on a range of topics on LinkedIn . He also frequently appears in the media and is a regular contributor to various publications, including The Financial Times , The Information , and Institutional Investor . We bring a human-centric approach to talent strategy, executive search, and professional search, creating value for businesses and people alike. LEARN MORE Unlock the human potential to accelerate business value. GET IN TOUCH Our Approach People drive business value. Today, business value has shifted from physical assets to human capital. People are now the primary drivers of business value – as a result, organizations must now take a more human-centric approach to unlock business potential. Our firm is built for this new era – to create business value driven by people. WHY LACEY LAKE leadership? We go deep to understand the “why” – your unique organizational needs, business drivers and value creation goals. We are agile and built to move at the speed of your business – and the market. We are flexible and customize solutions to meet your needs - and milestone-driven outcomes. We are motivated by a desire to have a meaningful impact - on both people and your business - through a human-centric approach. GET IN TOUCH Solutions We unlock the human potential to accelerate business value by identifying possibilities, attracting talent, and delivering business value. Our  solutions are tailored to your strategic business needs and intentional growth goals. Talent Strategy Leadership Team Advisory Human Capital Audit Executive Search Milestone-Based Executive Recruiting Board Advisor Executive Search Collaborative Market Mapping Professional Search Contained Mid-level Search Associate Search Accelerated Sourcing Success Stories Creating value for businesses and people alike. From corporate meetings, private parties, weddings, reunions, and more we have elegant space just for you. EXPLORE INSPIRED EVENTS Few places are more beautiful and accommodating than Lake Jovita Country Club. It’s been the setting for everything from weddings, corporate functions, fundraising galas, holiday parties, graduation celebrations, and more… BOOK EARLY. We’re already scheduling events for this fall and during the holiday season, so now is the time to reserve your spot on the calendar. SET YOUR BUDGET. There is typically a cost for guests, not including tax and service charge. We can accommodate budgets of around $40++ for luncheons to about $60++ for dinner & weekend events. Prices increase during the month of December and different pricing packages for wedding events. CHOOSE YOUR SPACE. You can rent out the entire Club for a soiree with around 260 people or choose the intimate Private Dining Room which holds about 50 people. Our Main Dining room can easily fit about 120 people including space to set to be utilized as a dance floor. DON’T PLAN ALONE. Planning the perfect event can be stressful if it’s not your day job. Our in house coordinator is here to help you put all of the details together for a rememberable event. If you would like to book an event, call 352-588-2233 ext.333 or via email at events@lakejovita.com CALL BACK REQUEST FORM Please enable JavaScript in your browser to complete this form. Lake Jovita Golf & Country Club (North Course) ⛳️ Book Golf Online • golfscape™ Explore Destinations Help Log In Sign Up Language Currency How can we help? How can I book a tee time? 1 Navigate to your preferred golf course. Select your date of play, tee time, rentals, and number of players – and then click Book. You will receive an instant email confirmation and your tee time will be guaranteed at the course. Can I modify or cancel a booking? 1 Absolutely! If you are within the cancellation policy of your tee time, navigate to the Manage Booking page to modify or cancel your booking. What is your cancellation policy? 1 You can typically cancel your booking for a full refund within 48 hours of your tee time, but this may vary slightly by course. Cancellation policies are defined by each golf course and are clearly marked during the entire booking process as well as in your email confirmation. Why should I book with golfscape? 1 We are the only service who’s technology operates at all our partner courses – that means tee times and rates on golfscape are sourced directly. So when you make a booking, your reservation is confirmed instantly at the golf course. How can I get more help? 1 You may communicate with us anytime using the button below or email us at [email protected] – we’re happy to help! Please contact us with request for more information on availability and pricing for your group. Stay and Play Villas feature 3 Bedrooms & 2 Baths. They comfortably sleep 2 to 6 people. FIND OUT MORE WORLD CLASS GOLF The courses were designed by PGA TOUR great Tom Lehman & award winning Architect Kurt Sandness. Our 1750 sq/ft Villas are fully furnished 3BR/2BA very private locations in a gated community overlooking the 18th & 9th greens and lake with a beautifully lit up fountain on one of Florida’s premier golf courses and VOTED TOP 100 PLACES TO LIVE . This modern Florida-style community is only 30 minutes N of Tampa and 45 minutes N of Tampa International Airport, 90 minutes W of Orlando International Airport. This Villa is exquisitely decorated with stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, porcelain & marble tiled floors, private master suite with 2 queen beds, large walk-in closet and separate guest rooms have private bath and laundry room. The Villa’s 12′ high ceilings and 40′ lanai are dramatic. The Clubhouse is only a 2 minute walk from the villas.
